element.name: Kilcrea Gate by Windsockers, Multi-cache (2.5/1.5)

long-description.p: Newbridge Demesne covers an area of 150 ha. (370 acres) The park was probably designed by the Wexford landscape gardener Charles Fritzell about 250 years ago. The parkland is a good example of an eighteenth century landscape park with perimeter woodland belts and fine vistas across lawns and wildflower meadows.
To find the cache you’ll have to visit a number of locations and obtain the appropriately disguised information
Go to the above coords and note how many people play this game call this number A

Here you will need to take note of the total number of windows in this building call this number B
Also take note of how many doors therewhere in this building call this number C
How many windows are there above the blocked up wooden door call this number D
Go to N53 28.(A*B)(C+D)(B+D) W6 09.(A+B)(B+D)(D-A) here you will need to take note of the four digit number and call this W.X.Y.Z
The cache is located at N53 28.(Z-W)(X-Y+W)Z W006 09.(W+X)(X-Y)(Z-Y)

element.additional-waypoints:
FNZR0E - GCZR0E Final
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___
S2ZR0E - GCZR0E Stage 2
N 53° 29.072 W 006° 09.875
S3ZR0E - GCZR0E Stage 3
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___

ul.li:
2010-06-01T19:00:00Z : Found it by theswerve
First attempt in Dec08.....second cache page since...had another go a couple of days ago...got S1 finally,,,all in all 3 visits amounting to about 7 hours spent on this...glad to knock this one off...as for S3....(Sigh)....Empty log...nice to sign a lovely clean sheet...TFTC...

2010-05-28T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by theswerve
Had a quick look at this evening after `Unfullfilled ambitions`....could not figure the link between A and bB in the maths for S3....found 4 numbers ok...but led me out to sea...Will have another go some day...

2010-03-14T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by orangetigerprawn
Frustrating end to the day. There are renovations, demolition and tree pruning going on at Stage 2 which ended up giving me coordinates for stage three that left me either in the middle of a field or in the middle of a forest with no numbers anywhere visible.

2010-02-15T12:43:04Z : Enable Listing by Windsockers
[green]Revamp complete all stages amended and final moved.[/green]

2010-02-14T10:39:14Z : Temporarily Disable Listing by Windsockers
[green]This cache needs to be revamped. final location is now extremely unsafe due to a falling trees close by.[/green]

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Kilcrea Gate
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Kilcrea Gate

Newbridge Demesne covers an area of 150 ha. (370 acres) The park was probably designed by the Wexford landscape gardener Charles Fritzell about 250 years ago. The parkland is a good example of an eighteenth century landscape park with perimeter woodland belts and fine vistas across lawns and wildflower meadows.

The Cache

To find the cache you’ll have to visit a number of locations and obtain the appropriately disguised information

Stage One

Go to the above coords and note how many people play this game call this number A

Stage Two

N53 29.072 W6 09.875

Here you will need to take note of the total number of windows in this building call this number B
Also take note of how many doors therewhere in this building call this number C
How many windows are there above the blocked up wooden door call this number D

Stage Three

Go to N53 28.(A*B)(C+D)(B+D) W6 09.(A+B)(B+D)(D-A) here you will need to take note of the four digit number and call this W.X.Y.Z

Final Location

The cache is located at N53 28.(Z-W)(X-Y+W)Z W006 09.(W+X)(X-Y)(Z-Y)

Park Opening Times

Nov. to Jan. 10.00 am - 5.00 pm
Feb. to Mar. 10.00 am - 6.00 pm
April 10.00 am - 7.00 pm
May 10.00 am - 8.00 pm
Jun. to Aug. 10.00 am - 9.00 pm
Sept. 10.00 am - 8.00 pm
Oct. 10.00 am - 7.00 pm


The Windsockers

Additional Waypoints

FNZR0E - GCZR0E Final
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___

S2ZR0E - GCZR0E Stage 2
N 53° 29.072 W 006° 09.875

S3ZR0E - GCZR0E Stage 3
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___

Had a quick look at this evening after `Unfullfilled ambitions`....could not figure the link between A and bB in the maths for S3....found 4 numbers ok...but led me out to sea...Will have another go some day...

Frustrating end to the day. There are renovations, demolition and tree pruning going on at Stage 2 which ended up giving me coordinates for stage three that left me either in the middle of a field or in the middle of a forest with no numbers anywhere visible.
